review:
First of all, I did kind of assume this was regular solitaire (I got this game way back in 2017 and only just now played it), so that's my fault for not remembering correctly. That being said, I did enjoy this weird style of solitaire (it's still similar but you have only 3 suits/colors that you need to move to the foundation plus you have 3 more non-numbered suits of 4 cards each that also have their own foundation). It is interesting to balance and took a little bit to get the hang of. I'm not quite sure if the game's claim to "98% solveable" is correct but it comes across as feeling like the game should be easy to beat, though I didn't come close to beating even 90% of my deals (though it could just be me not being good enough). The graphics are extremely basic with the exception for the random start page. 

I didn't experience any bugs while playing the game, thankfully. It would be nice to have a bit more to do in the game, even if they were just graphical (like different backgrounds or card styles). However, the game is still pretty addicting for being a super simple twist on solitaire.

Overall, I did enjoy playing this game. I would recommend this game to solitaire fans.

review:
Who knew that a game of solitaire could be so intense? SHENZHEN SOLITAIRE takes the classic card game and adds a high-tech twist, making for some seriously mind-bending gameplay. The graphics are sleek and futuristic, the soundtrack will have you feeling like a cybernetic super-genius, and the fact that it's just solitaire means you don't have to worry about anyone stealing your high scores on the leaderboard.

Overall, I'd say this game is a must-play for anyone who's ever wanted to feel like a hacker while playing solitaire. And let's be real, who hasn't?

review:
[h3]二十数手の勝負[/h3]　流石はZachtronicsのお家芸、一切の抜かりがない。Zachが唯一単品で売る、それだけの確かな質があります。
概ねフリーセルですが、麻雀牌を流用しているためスートが3つあります。EXAPUNKSのПасьянсをそのまま中華風に仕立てた感じですね。
2色のトランプを用いたソリティアではほぼ無意味であったシーケンス間の組み換えが、非常に大きな意味を持つことになります。このギミックのお陰で手詰まりが回避しやすくなっており、かなりシビアな初期配置が辛うじて解ける絶妙なゲームバランスが成立しています。
それほど複雑な盤面でありながら、たった20回札を動かせば解けてしまいます。所要時間1-2分。PCのみならずスマートフォン版の発売も待たれます。[strike]iOSに非公式移植されていますが、クリア回数が5000回を超えました[/strike]

review:
雖然我其實有SHENZHEN I/O但一直沒有打開（你倒是開啊）
總是耳聞SOLITAIRE才是他的本體，每天都很缺轉換心情用的小遊戲的我就買了。
但在打開遊戲的瞬間，心情只剩下「這怎麼玩？？？？？？」
之後摸索了半天終於會玩之後，感想是「這哪裡好玩了大家吹過頭了吧……」然後一邊打一邊想著是不是早早退款好。
>>>>>>然後就上癮了<<<<<<<<
結論就是這樣，為什麼會這樣？
真的很適合沒事開來打一兩局沒什麼負擔。
一開始覺得很難後來習慣後就覺得「啊其實也就這樣嘛沒什麼簡單簡單啊……死掉了……」
雖然仔細打下去並不困難但時常會一步錯就整盤都死掉，因為只是陽春系統，所以也沒有從頭來過跟復原剛才動作的選項，真的只剩下挑戰下一局的功能了。這點是比較令人詬病，不過想想他原本也就是別的遊戲裡的一個小遊戲，也不能要求他太多。
總之，打牌吧！

review:
Easily the best original Solitaire variant on Steam. It's addictive and fun!

My only critique is that the win counter breaks occasionally and resets to 0, however this doesn't affect your achievement progress. The game also does not alert you when decks are unsolvable and thus you're left having to figure that out on your own, but once you become used to the logic of the game it becomes pretty easy to recognize from the start.

Overall, a great purchase if you're looking for something that'll kill time and challenge you.

review:
Un solitaire dès plus particulier. Très bon jeu sur lequel je m'amuse énormément ! Pas cher pour ce que c'est, c'est un bon passe temps et qui, de manière originale, à ses propres règles, notamment les 4 dragons de 3 différents types (pas mal !). Pas grand chose à dire si ce n'est que je le recommande vivement et que, pour son prix, on peut s'éclater dessus. Beaucoup de positif mais néanmoins 2 petits bémols :
- La compréhension du fonctionnement ainsi que des règles est très flou au début, il est difficile de savoir quoi faire pendant nos premières parties.
- La page tutoriel expliquant le jeu qui, à mon sens, manque de détails pour comprendre les mécanismes de ce solitaire.
Mais ce ne sont que de "petits" bémols, en soi, le jeu est sympa et divertissant.
Et hop ! Il part dans mes favoris celui-là ! :)

I will never be smart enough for zachtronics puzzlers, but I love solitaire, and this is an excellent one. no story, no goals, even though I prefer to have some generally, just the solitaire you might've played to death as a kid (or adult) because it came with windows.

review:
An enjoyable and addictive solitaire game based off Freecell that uses 40 Mahjong cards. However note that game lacks an undo or hint button as well as the rules not being hugely helpful. Overall however, the game is unique and addictive, along with being dirt cheap at full price. Recommend!

[h1]Shenzhen Solitaire rules[/h1]

Shenzhen Solitaire is an interesting solitaire card game similar to Freecell using Mahjong cards (although the game is technically playable with mahjong tiles also), that boasts an apparent 98% solvability rate for each shuffle. Shenzhen Solitaire was originally created as a mini-game distraction for Zachitronics game Shenzhen I/O. A standalone release is also available for a very reasonable price of £1.99 ($2.99/€2.99) on Steam. Additionally there are several ports, including an official port of the game to DOS, an official port to Apple iOS and an unofficial open-source port to HTML5 and JavaScript.

The game uses the following 40 mahjong cards:

[list]
[*]9 character cards (1 to 9)
[*]9 coin cards (1 to 9)
[*]9 bamboo cards (1 to 9)
[*]4 green dragon cards
[*]4 red dragon cards
[*]4 white dragon cards
[*]1 flower card
[/list]

The goal of Shenzhen Solitaire is to remove all cards from their tableaus. This means placing all the mahjong dragon cards (green, red, white) in the 3 cells on the left, the flower card in the centre and the suit cards (characters, coins and bamboo) in the 3 foundations on the right.

To start the game, shuffle the cards and then lay them face up in 8 horizontal rows of tableaus with 5 cards each, similar to Freecell.

Initially there are 3 cells and 4 empty foundations. 3 cells for dragon cards, 1 foundation for the flower card and 3 foundations for all 9 cards of each mahjong suit. Much like Freecell, you can move suit cards onto alternating suits in ascending or descending order and place 1 card into a cell at a time.

Dragon cards can only be moved to an empty cell or tableau. If all 4 dragon cards are at the front of tableau or in a cell, then they can be transferred to that cell providing one of those cards is already in a cell or an empty cell is available. The cards are then placed in a stack face-down in that cell and the cell is then removed from play.

The flower card is automatically placed in the foundation between the dragon and suit cards when it’s at the front of a tableau and can be moved.

As far as I can tell, this solitaire game is not included with Shenzhen I/O, unless I'm overlooking it somehow.  I haven't played a lot of Shenzhen I/0, so maybe you get it as a bonus after completing some task or other, but it is not on the initial display.

review:
I was just forced to switch from Windows 7 to Windows 10, and with that move went my ad-free solitaire game. I still had SHENZHEN installed despite already 100% the achievements so I decided to try it as a replacement. I'm a writer, okay, and I [i]need[/i] my solitaire while I think things over (or just procrastinate on my wordcount, whatever.)

That was a little under two weeks ago, started with 104 wins and now I'm at 4x that many. The lack of undo mechanism combined with the three suit deck of cards makes this version of solitaire a very zenlike way to spend your time, and once you get into the rhythm you really don't need all of your focus to get through the each hand.

I absolutely recommend this game to anyone looking for a solitaire varient that either replaces the crazed ugliness of what Windows 10 gives us now, or even just wanting something new to occupy your brain stem. It's simple, it's easy to run, it's [i]cheap[/i], and if the devs want to make more card games for us then I shouldn't be the only one willing to jump on that pony and ride it, wink wink nudge nudge.

review:
Quite a worthy Solitaire game, to which you need to get used to a little, for the hieroglyphics and the system of three decks and cards-"dragons", which you need to collect by four and fold to the right, after that, you can finally collect the decks according to the numbers.

Very decent code work, interface and music. Slightly unaccustomed are the cards itself (visuals), they are elongated in length, but this quickly ceases to be noticed.

Three achievements to complete - 1 victory, 10 and 100. The difficulty does not change in any way. While it's not possible to collect all the layouts quickly, but in general, due to the fact that each game is going really fast (about a minute, maybe), you can collect 100 games in a few hours. Or stretch the pleasure, if you like to split up a party or two from time to time.

Mark 9/10. I can't wish anything more from the solitaire game (except maybe customizable difficulty), it's good as it is.

PS: This game has one itch for which some people don't like it much. It will only give you "complete" badge after the full 100 wins. And it is certainly a long way, maybe a full 24h cycle, if you're not so good in planning. On the other hand, after I've played about half-way to that badge, I've realized what was that for. You see, this Solitaire is the part of the learning course. Its trial-and-error process is kinda framing your point of view, in a way that could be useful for the full-time coder, who want to do his work better than usual script-kiddies. To fix that malefication of the coding work, known for me from my background as "Indian codework". Now, mind it, it is not about the whole body of Indian coders and researchers, I know some brilliant minds among them! But, when we look at the global scale of the so-called "flat world", not so many people are ready to pay for the really proficient codework, if they don't know the difference. You'll not become a solid coder after playing some solitaire game, of course. However, at the very least, if you'll try, you'll see what I was talking about.

review:
深圳Solitaire和昆特牌一样，都是硬核游戏中附带的小游戏——许多购买深圳I/O的人，最后发现自己几十个小时都花在了它上面。

这个游戏充斥着古朴的00年代小游戏的风味，无论是开局页面上【huaqiangbei】的字样，还是单曲循环却毫不令人厌烦的电子配乐。
都让人有种回到了家乡的“数码广场”
充斥着奸商、盗版碟、一地电脑零配件、还有【点卡、IP卡、IC卡】的吆喝声的场所。

游戏内容属于一种改版的空当接龙。
牌面是麻将牌的花色，条子、筒子、万子、中发白，（没有风），额外一张花字牌（春）
三个存牌区，但每当中发白被全部解开，则会占用一个。
整体难度很大，一张牌挪错，就可能流局。

很适合办公室休闲，三个成就全解锁需要胜利100次，还不算难。
真的想不到这是一款做出了I/O等一堆硬核游戏的工作室的作品……

review:
I haven't played Shenzhen I/O yet but I simply love this Freecell variation.

It's slightly tougher (IMO) than Freecell but the games are a lot shorter. It's easy to shotgun several at a time to kill a few minutes. It doesn't take long for a few games to turn into a few dozen, either. Great zone-out tool.

My only wish is that there were a few more stats available (total games, win rate, average time, etc.) other than just games won. Maybe these can be added in a future update. Regardless, I'll keep playing. Put it on Android too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094741510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 10180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 310, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1712418334}
review:
トランプのスートの代わりに麻雀牌のPMZ1～9と撥・中・白各々4枚及び花牌1枚の計40枚のカードを使って行うフリーセル。
ただし普通のフリーセルと異なり、場としてのフリーセルは3枚まで、
移動に関してはフリーセルが関与しない(常に何枚でも可能)、
重ねる際のスートは赤・黒交互ではなく下のスートと異なればOK、字牌は重ねる事ができない、
字牌は場に4枚出た状態でボタンを押せばフリーセル領域を1つ専有して格納される、花牌は固有の枠がある、等。
基本的に一風変わったフリーセルなのでヒマ潰しに最適。
ただしアンドゥ・リドゥ機能は無いので、詰んだら大人しくNewGameを。

author: {'steamid': '76561198263779452', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1561671859}
review:
Meine Erwartungen an dieses Solitaire waren nicht sehr hoch, schließlich kennt so mancher seit Windows 3.0 viele Kartenspiele mit dem Titel Solitaire und denkt sich, "Ach bitte nicht noch ein Solitaire".
Aber ich wurde eines besseren Belehrt, anfangs irritieren die Symbole noch etwas doch das Spielprinzip ist denkbar einfach, jedoch darf man gerne genauer hinschauen und überlegen ob der gedachte Zug wirklich sinnvoll ist oder ein anderer besser wäre.

Shenzhen Solitaire macht ab dem „Auspacken“ einfach nur Spaß und sollte keinesfalls in der „Deckblatt Sammlung“ fehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009013509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1682812267}
review:
The game itself is not bad, but there are no numbered deals, undo, or replay, and it only counts how many games you've won (not the total you've played), so I can't tell what percentage I've won.

The strategy seems top-heavy towards removing the three sets of four dragons; packing the tableau and building foundations seems just a means to that end.   And the flower card is pointless.

The rules are vague and incomplete, though an experienced solitaire player can figure out what's missing.

Having now played it for a while, I feel the game is worthwhile despite the lack of features in the app.

review:
Actually a surprisingly unique and refreshing take on FreeCell. I have an inkling that the fact that there's no Undo button and you can't pull cards off the foundation...might just be a deliberate thing on part of the developer. It's a very simple game, exactly the sort of thing that you'd find bundled with an OS or device, which given where this game came from, I'd say the author(s?) absolutely nailed it.

If you're after a solitaire game that won't make you feel bad for losing, where every win is a victory, grab this.

(EDIT) I wrote a much longer review/profile about Shenzhen Solitaire for my blog, Turn of a Friendly Card: https://thefriendlycard.wordpress.com/2017/02/08/shenzhen-solitaire-2016-steam/ - it's not really a *review* in that I give it a score, but I do talk about some things that may influence your purchase decision. I do still highly recommend the game, in summary.

review:
I thought it would be tough and obtuse, as I expect SHENZHEN I/O to be. But it turned out to be very easy, casual, and pretty interesting. It's minimalistic in many aspects: no Undo, only three suits. It's mildly unusual: "dragons" that are kind of three separate suits with different collection rules, a "flower" card that is there seemingly for some symbolic reason and having practically no influence on the game.

Recommended as a casual coffee break solitaire.
